snippet: The Federal Highway Administration asked for the new crash tests after a federal jury found Trinity liable for defrauding the government by not disclosing design changes to the system.
abstract: Trinity Industries will conduct new crash tests on its ET-Plus guardrail system that will be closely watched by transportation regulators around country; Federal Highway Admin requested new tests after federal jury found Trinity liable for defrauding government by not disclosing design changes to system; more than 30 states have banned system.

byline.contributor: Danielle Ivory contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The Federal Highway Administration asked for the new crash tests after a federal jury found Trinity liable for defrauding the government by not disclosing design changes to the system.

headline.main: Critical Tests to Begin on Highway Guardrail Banned in Most States
headline.print_headline: Critical Tests to Begin on Highway Guardrail Banned in Most States
